Interaction of <extra_id_0> fibronectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> with <extra_id_0> VLA-5 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cells induces the AP-1 transcription factor .

<extra_id_0> Fibronectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> synergized with anti-CD3 antibody to promote <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cell proliferation in a serum-free culture system whereas no proliferation was observed when <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cells were cultured with anti-CD3 alone or <extra_id_0> fibronectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alone .

In addition , anti - <extra_id_0> CD29 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( i <extra_id_0> ntegrin beta 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) as well as anti - <extra_id_0> VLA-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( human fibronectin receptor ) antibodies blocked this <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cell activation in this system .

Although anti-CD3 alone or <extra_id_0> fibronectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alone can not induce <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> message by <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cells , the combination of anti-CD3 plus <extra_id_0> fibronectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> message by CD4 cells .

In an analysis of the molecular mechanism by which <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> message was generated , we showed that a <extra_id_0> fibronectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> VLA-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> fibronectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> receptor interaction may contribute an independent signal distinct from the CD3 pathway of activation by the induction of an AP-1 transcriptional factor .

Thus the <extra_id_0> VLA-5 fibronectin receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cells can play a complementary role in CD3-TCR - mediated signal transduction through its interaction with <extra_id_0> fibronectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
